page.title: 16THORNTON LE MOOR VILLAGE (1)
page.content: Thornton Le Moor is a long thin village following the village road. Some of the houses are over three hundred years old and some have only been built this year. Some of the houses are very large, like the house that use to belong to the Brewery owners, when there a Brewery in the village, Some houses though are tiny village cottages. There are two farms in the village, one is mainly a dairy farm and the other is an arable farm. There is a church which is about a hundred years old, and a tiny methodist chapel that only holds about 30 people. There is a public house called"The Black Swan" and a village school. There are 32 of us at the moment in the school but when it was originally built in the victorian Times ,it was built for 120 children.
